645523451.name: Love this shop!
645523451.author: a TripAdvisor user
645523451.reviewBody: So glad to find this wonderful store in San Pancho! The owners, Layne and Ricardo, have traveled throughout Mexico to find beautiful and unique handmade items for every budget and style. I especially like their textiles and ceramics.  The store is enchanting and inspiring and I can\'t wait to visit them again soon!

569981084.name: Rare find. Beautiful store, beautiful craftwork. Utterly charming.
569981084.author: a TripAdvisor user
569981084.reviewBody: Like it\u2019s owners Layne and Ricardo, Luna Layne is warm and welcoming. It\u2019s a beautifully appointed store with an eclectic collecton of exceptional artisan works from all over Mexico. Layne and Ricardo have a deep knowledge and love of the craftwork they sell. They help support the artisans who are masters of their craft in textiles, ceramics, and woodwork, amongst others. It\u2019s a delight to walk through their store, it\u2019s designed to yield surprising and charming discoveries at every turn. To my mind, it\u2019s the best store of it\u2019s kind in San Pancho, if not in the general vicinity in and around Puerto Vallarta. If you are ever in San Pancho, it is a must see.

566867514.name: Uniquely Different
566867514.author: a TripAdvisor user
566867514.reviewBody: While in San Pancho, as in all other small Mexican towns, we spent some time wandering through the shops catering to tourists and locals. As a tried and seasoned shopper, and a person who appreciates crafts and artistry, I was really impressed with the quality of the goods available for purchase at this small shop. The owner, who was busily packing some items for a satisfied customer, was more than happy to spend time explaining how and where the items purchased in her shop are sourced. I got the feeling that this store helps support and encourage the local economy of the area. If you are looking for unique, beautifully hand-made items, and are willing to pay a fair price for originality and craftmanship, this is a place to check out. The shop itself is located on the main street to the beach, lined with interesting and beautifully painted houses along with other small shops where the vendors (some transplanted Canadians and Americans) are friendly, helpful, and pleasant.

549953639.name: A Great Find in San Pancho
549953639.author: a TripAdvisor user
549953639.reviewBody: This lovely store has some excellent Mexican art, crafts, and textiles. The owners (Ricardo and Layne) are friendly and knowledgeable and we purchased a stunning carpet for our new home in Nuevo.  We will return to see more treasures on our next visit.

547757359.name: Eclectic, impeccable taste
547757359.author: a TripAdvisor user
547757359.reviewBody: A shop full of tempting folk art from Mexico to Morocco. The owners, Layne and Ricardo, are always looking for the best.

546058249.name: Great Shop
546058249.author: a TripAdvisor user
546058249.reviewBody: NIcely curated selection of crafts and friendly owner.  Prices reasonable for the quality.  Recommend it.  Best in San Pancho.

466814607.name: Thank You
466814607.author: a TripAdvisor user
466814607.reviewBody: I visited Luna Layne on Thursday, March 9,  2017.    While looking at the lovely merchandise, I inadvertently broke the top of an artisanal item worth 1000 pesos.  Hearing and seeing my distress, one of the owners, Ricardo Tallamante, came over to assure me that he understood it was an accident.  I offerered to buy/and or repair  the piece but he was adamant that was not necessary.  He was very gracious and helpful.  I appreciated the way he handled this situation.  Thank you for your understanding.

466639599.name: Beautiful Shop!
466639599.author: a TripAdvisor user
466639599.reviewBody: Very nice shop with lots of handmade items. Beautifully displayed. Proprietor was knowledgeable about his wares.

464620288.name: Darling store, great quality treasures from various parts of Mexico!
464620288.author: a TripAdvisor user
464620288.reviewBody: Ricardo and Layne are extremely helpful and can tell you every detail about the gifts they have in the store. Whether it\'s unique pottery, linens, purses, home decor or jewelry, their store is unique and moderately priced. I wouldn\'t miss a visit, I stop in every year!

463780437.name: Diamond in the Rough!!
463780437.author: a TripAdvisor user
463780437.reviewBody: Layne and Ricardo were extremely happy to help us find exactly what we were looking for. Every year we come back they have new exciting things from all over the country!

463723880.name: Upscale boutique worth a visit!
463723880.author: a TripAdvisor user
463723880.reviewBody: Lane, the owner, has excellent taste!   She has filled her boutique with high-quality rugs, pillows, throws, and much more for the home.   The colors in the shop reflect the richness of Mexico!   My partner and I purchased three colorful pillows for our master bedroom and they look just great in our home!  Lane designs some of what she sells, and she is a great resource for mixing and matching.  When in San Pancho, make sure to drop in to Luna Layne, you can\'t miss it right on the main street with all of the restaurants and shops.

463723626.name: lovely diverse gift shop
463723626.author: a TripAdvisor user
463723626.reviewBody: This small but filled gift shop offers a wide variety of items...from antique jewelry to textiles and pottery from across Mexico and Latin America that you can\'t get anywhere else in the pueblo. I have been stopping in each year when I am in San Pancho since it opened to see what is new and to hear about the owners\' (Layne and Ricardo) buying adventures.  And I love to see how Layne arranges it all...

458663327.name: Overpriced
458663327.author: a TripAdvisor user
458663327.reviewBody: Beautifully displayed pieces but if you shop around at other stores you will find that buying from the local residents or from the Tuesday market in the square will give you these same authentic pieces for 1/3 the price. Shop local but not here.

458198412.name: Well done ,gift shop in this tiny village
458198412.author: a TripAdvisor user
458198412.reviewBody: I met the owners the first year they were open and I really enjoyed the decor and the variety of pieces they carry . We love visiting this village and their shop.

457369525.name: A treasure trove of authentic pieces from true artisans of Mexico
457369525.author: a TripAdvisor user
457369525.reviewBody: We were in San Pancho for a week and had to visit this shop several times. The shopkeepers, Layne and Ricardo were very knowledgeable on the different pieces from pottery to textiles. They travel to small markets and villages all over Mexico and hand pick the pieces the display in their shop, and had stories of their travels and historical data on the artisans. There was a little history lesson in each piece we asked about. We plan on visiting San Pancho again and definitely look forward to visiting Layne and Ricardo to see what adventures they go on next and what treasures they find.

456758416.name: Great Shop
456758416.author: a TripAdvisor user
456758416.reviewBody: My wife purchased tow wallets made in Chiapas for friends.  Owner is from Northern California and spends the winter in San Pancho.  Very interesting inventory.

451678203.name: Hidden Treasures
451678203.author: a TripAdvisor user
451678203.reviewBody: We have travel to San Pancho a handful of times and have always taken a look into the store. It is full of wonderful pieces from all over Mexico, that Layne and her husband have had made by local artist throughout Mexico. WE found 3 wonderful wool POM POM pillow covers that will add to our eclectic style  in our home. I also found a silver cuff from a women collection from the 1950\'s ,she had collected different pieces of jewelry for years in her travels and released them to Layne. If this beautiful piece of silver jewelry could talk. There several more pieces from the estates collection and many delightful treasures to add a personal eclectic style to your casa. Worth stopping by just to see what they have found! I\'ll be back!

364419434.name: Beautiful products and delightful owners
364419434.author: a TripAdvisor user
364419434.reviewBody: We stopped in twice because my friend was haunted by something she saw and hadn\'t purchased. The owners enjoyed telling us the background of the items they stocked. Looking forward to returning home with my treasures! Will probably regret not buying more!

359364896.name: Beauty, quality & delightful owners!
359364896.author: a TripAdvisor user
359364896.reviewBody:
What a surprise to find this treasure trove on the way to the beach. I got totally engrossed exploring the beauty in this well appointed shop. Every time I stopped in -- which was every day! -- I found another charming item I had missed.

Layne and Ricardo are warm, gracious, knowledgeable host/shopkeepers. Chatting with them and the people who meander in and linger is as pleasurable as viewing the pieces they display so well. Each item was clearly chosen carefully for both the beauty of the design and the quality of the materials and workmanship. 

When I return next year to San Pancho, I'll head to Luna Layne right after check-in!

356214822.name: Cute Shop, but Really Pricie
356214822.author: a TripAdvisor user
356214822.reviewBody: Luna Layne is a cute little shop, but not really that exciting for us.  Things were nice to look at but I found the prices really high.  It wasn\'t a highlight for us.

346633397.name: Beautiful Shop
346633397.author: a TripAdvisor user
346633397.reviewBody:
Loved this cute shop!
So many beautiful things to look at.
Layne and Ricardo have a great eye for local artisans wares.
I can't wait to return and see what's new in this wonderful shop!

345580876.name: A Beautiful and unique store with thoughtful, wonderful,owners
345580876.author: a TripAdvisor user
345580876.reviewBody: Walking in you know you are in a special place, the products are lovely and the owners go all the way in good service, information, assistance with shipping...no pressure, easy going...\n\nLuna Layne is like my overall experience of San Pancho, friendly, caring, easy going, and next thing you know you have been in this little, delightful space for an hour.

345577565.name: Pleasant surprise
345577565.author: a TripAdvisor user
345577565.reviewBody: Wow! What a pleasant surprise. This boutique has a fine array of Mexican artistry. Everything is meticulously placed to make shopping enjoyable. It is obvious the owners are creative and are determined to offer products that are not in every other store in town. This is definitely the place for the one of a kind gift. Can\'t wait to come back.

345273278.name: Some unique pieces of art & a very friendly owner
345273278.author: a TripAdvisor user
345273278.reviewBody: We stopped in and were surprised as the shop from the outside looks small. The owner if very friendly & knows the area well so is a great source of information. The art is unique & unlike anything else in San Pancho. We would return here to shop

344277572.name: a local arts and crafts treasure
344277572.author: a TripAdvisor user
344277572.reviewBody: If you are looking for beautiful, well made Mexican arts and crafts this is the store to visit. Products are attractively displayed and the owners have a wealth of knowledge about  where the products came from, who made them and how they are made. In addition, they generously donate a percentage of their sales to support local educational programs for San Pancho  children.

344091937.name: Only one like it!
344091937.author: a TripAdvisor user
344091937.reviewBody: I love this enchanting store with its friendly service!  Luna Layne, located on our main street, is a charming gift boutique filled with an unique assortment of carefully chosen and original treasures for gifts and home. There is only one like it!...JB

344087486.name: unusual and fine quality crafts from around Mexico
344087486.author: a TripAdvisor user
344087486.reviewBody: Really stellar shop offering beautiful and unusual and unusually fine quality craft goods and antiques from all over Mexico.  A must stop and see!

342810705.name: Great Shop
342810705.author: a TripAdvisor user
342810705.reviewBody: Luna Layne provides a taste of magic. Pottery from all over Mexico. Stunning art pieces!\nA great place to shop and take home a little piece of Mexico.

340318784.name: Exquisite selection of artisanal Mexican and Mexican-inspired art and home goods.
340318784.author: a TripAdvisor user
340318784.reviewBody: Beautifully curated gallery featuring handmade items by Mexican artisans and home goods including ceramic sculpture, textiles and jewelry. Located on Tercer Mundo in the heart of San Pancho.

673468278.name: Jungle Tour
673468278.author: a TripAdvisor user
673468278.reviewBody:
Went on tour yesterday and would highly recommend it. 
Tour guide was a young man named Vincente who is charming very likeable and knowledgeable. Learned a lot about the jungle and issues they face. Would like to go again during the rainy season as things can change dramatically with all plant life after months of no rain at all. It is very easy to tell that Vincente and Jose do their tours out of true love for the jungle and the environment in general

vincente

662598016.name: Unlike any other!
662598016.author: a TripAdvisor user
662598016.reviewBody:
This is about as unique and grassroots an experience as exists.  Alejandro and Jose have created something beautiful and authentic. Vincente is the perfect host and teacher.  V picked up up and delivered us back to San Pancho and curated a brilliant tour of the gardens and history, the animals, and the grounds with such obvious passion and honesty.  Jose joined us for most of the tour and while he only spoke in the native tongue, his passion was clear and the message was easily conveyed.  
This is not your standard tour for gringos with lunch and luxury, but an off-the-beaten-path view at what a few people's passion can manifest.  It is for Plant Lovers.  It is a bit expensive overall. We did not mind, as we are passionate about orchids and other flora, and had a customized tour, but it could be prohibitive for families at 500 pesos each.  Not for children who depend upon a screen to pass the time. They'd be bored. Must be fully mobile to enjoy this tour as it is on rugged trails, but maybe a half mile of trail at most.  You could stop anywhere and discuss forever the myriad plants surrounding.
Access could be developed to bring in all kinds of tours, but I hope that does not happen.   It is too fragile.
Such a different take on "gardens" from the Vallarta Botanic Gardens, which, while very different, are also excellent in their own way.  We were happy to experience both.

659299529.name: Thank you Vincente and Jose for Wonderful Tour!
659299529.author: a TripAdvisor user
659299529.reviewBody: I was so happy to have the opportunity to visit this jungle garden just outside of San Pancho for the morning tour. We met in Las Lomas and were joined by four other travelers for our morning tour of the beautiful garden tended and created for over 20 years by Vincente\'s Uncle Jose.The tour was packed with information about the area, the indigenous plants, trees and medicinal uses and was a perfect introduction to the jungle of this area that we otherwise would not have seen. It was also good to see this teaching with love and respect for nature being passed down through the generations,as we were accompanied that day by Vincente\'s son. I was glad to be able to help support the beautiful work they do and encourage everyone to visit this special place.

654016489.name: Great jungle/orchid garden tour
654016489.author: a TripAdvisor user
654016489.reviewBody: This is a wonderfully cared for property that balances nature and people\u2019s needs. You can walk the several acres with Jose or Vincente and see and learn about the jungle and about the Mexican orchids they grow. It\u2019s quite impressive, and just a wonderful experience and way to spend a few hours. Birds, bugs, stories of snakes and jaguars, exotic fragrant plants, and very plainly a labor of love. If I come back to San Pancho, I\u2019m coming back to see it at a different time of year. April-May would be ideal to see the many orchids In bloom.

650729066.name: Beautiful garden
650729066.author: a TripAdvisor user
650729066.reviewBody: It was a delight to tour the garden with Jose and Vincente. I was impressed with all the work that went into creating this beautiful place. So many orchids and bromeliads are being cultivated. The tour takes you on a path through a wilder jungle and then a more cultivated garden area and greenhouse. We visited in early February, the dry season, so not a lot of blooms but still great to see the vegetation and plantings. Jose pointed out the medicinal and edible plants and we sampled some of them.

650415840.name: Very educational and lot\'s of fun!
650415840.author: a TripAdvisor user
650415840.reviewBody:
Everyone in our 6 ppl group love this tour. 
The ride into the reserve is a blast and the two tour guides Jose and Vincente were awesome and very informative.
The park walkways are well maintained (my uncle who just had his hip replaced was able to take the tour).
Only about 30 mins drive from Bucerias, where you meet them at a elementary school in Las Lomas. Also wear light pants and a t-shirt, "it's the jungle there are bugs".
Would definitely recommend this tour to anybody!

649386041.name: Great time en la perla
649386041.author: a TripAdvisor user
649386041.reviewBody: We took a bus from Bucerias with 2 kids (1 baby and a 3 yr old) to a small village of Las Lomas (about 5km) North of San Pancho. The tour guides do a great job and we enjoyed the jungle tour. It was about 2.5hrs.

646663304.name: Natural Jungle
646663304.author: a TripAdvisor user
646663304.reviewBody:
Here's our text for your review of it is ok I will publish.  

Lo de Perla Jungle Garden ecotour. We spent a pleasant afternoon taking this prearranged walk through a preserved jungle area in January 2019. 

 Arrangements are easily made on-line. We had a private tour with a local guide who spoke good english. we were met just off the highway at Los Lomas (5 miles from San Pancho). Vincente picked us up in his jeep and we slowly ventured in about 3 km on a very rough dirt road. Vincente explained the efforts to preserve this beautiful area of the jungle, and their horticulture efforts to grow orchids. We walked on a trail up and down for about 1 km while learning about the trees, history of the area and the work with the orchids. The walk was not difficult, with many stops to rest. We enjoyed the quiet and natural surroundings of Lo de Perla. The work being done here for the natural preservation is so important for habitat of Jaguars and other native species. Highly recommended anytime for all ages.

644150656.name: Wonderful tour
644150656.author: a TripAdvisor user
644150656.reviewBody: Great place to visit and be outdoors. Learned about local ecology and history from Vincente, our knowledgeable and friendly guide. Saw some beautiful flowers. Go if you are in the area. Flowers in greater bloom in May, but still a lot to see and learn.

644022537.name: Beautiful, peaceful place in the jungle!
644022537.author: a TripAdvisor user
644022537.reviewBody: We all loved the tour! Walking through the jungle with our knowledgeable guide Vincente explaining all the flora and fauna of the area. Meeting Jose who takes so much pride in the tending of this beautiful area. We were early for the orchids but that didn\'t matter to us at all. So nice to see people caring about the earth and natural surroundings. it was an easy pick up in San Pancho and only 10 minutes up the road through a bush trail. Being from northern Ontario this was an easy ride for us and the trail was an easy 1km.  No problem for my grandson who is five. I would definitely recommend this tour for anyone in the area. Was the quiet I needed since I love being close to nature and just the noise from the figs dropping from the trees, birds etc. Thank you all for the hard work and pride put in to such a beautiful area!!

569701557.name: Inspiring
569701557.author: a TripAdvisor user
569701557.reviewBody: Alejandro and his staff (Jos\u00e9, Jimena and Javier) treated us to a wonderful tour of their jungle. While only ten minutes off the very busy Highway 200 between San Pancho and Lo de Marcos, Lo de Perla is another world. It is a spectacular display of nature at its best aided by the tireless efforts of Jos\u00e9 to cultivate a huge variety of orchids. While we were a bit early to see them in bloom we can imagine how beautiful it will be in the season. Jos\u00e9 takes great pride in his work and will keep you spell bound with his stories. Lo de Perla is only about forty nominates from Bucerias and well worth your time.

567344535.name: Fantastic opportunity to learn about Jungle flora/fauna
567344535.author: a TripAdvisor user
567344535.reviewBody:
To see the Orchids blooming in the trees go in April and October!

But I didn’t have that kind of flexibility and loved the knowledge exchange and experience so much!!!
There is so MUCH to see anytime!!!

You will need to prebook (reserve) ahead as they arrange a translator for groups. 

Phone or email ahead. 
They will give you bus, taxi, or driving instructions to arrive at the community just north of San Pancho for the meeting location by the elementary school on the highway. 

It’s a 10 min drive in on very bumpy roads

The site guide is a local of 20 years that has lived in the natural surroundings all his adult life of 60 yrs (Jose)

Jose shares his wealth of knowledge and has build the trails, bridges, and steps you will walk on

It’s a relatively easy walk of 1 km, there is a very well maintained path, some inclines, stepping stones and be sure to wear pants or have excellent bug spray. 
The bugs seem to bite hard and you will be left with some very itchy bites if you don’t spray and they like you:)

Learned so much about the natural evolution that takes place with the tropical birds and their fertilization and spreading of seeds. 

Squirrels are impacting the orchid growth- they are pesky critters everywhere:)

We had a nibble on some stalk of a plant, sat at a handmade table and stools. 

The canopy of foliage along with the mountain vista view is spectacular. 

We learned so much being from a very non tropical country, it is a beautiful property and so fortunate to have learned from Jose’s lifetime of jungle care. 

Sad to learn that the birds have died that are needed to propagate the vanilla bean :(

499245042.name: A must see! Incredible jungle tour
499245042.author: a TripAdvisor user
499245042.reviewBody: We loved the tour! Incredible walking through the jungle with amazingly knowledgeable and passionate guide. The orchids were beautiful and it was great to learn about the flora and fauna of the region. A definite highlight on our trip in San Pancho. Definitely recommended!

482775988.name: Great tour
482775988.author: a TripAdvisor user
482775988.reviewBody:
I really wanted to go on this tour as hiking around the jungle and learning about the different plants and seeing the views sounded fun. It was great!

Alejandro kindly offered to pick me up, and take me back, to San Pancho for a very reasonable price. From pick up to drop off it was about 5 to 5.5 hours. The ride to his location was a bumpy blast. Very fun!

When the tour starts, Alejandro provides water and a walking stick if you need one. 

I really enjoyed this tour. He was very interesting and informative.  Thank you Alejandro. I had a really good time.

I'll add photos when I get my cell phone back. It's in for repair.

481722049.name: Awesome Tour!
481722049.author: a TripAdvisor user
481722049.reviewBody: Had a great tour of the Jungle Garden, Alejandro was very knowledgable and led a very interesting tour! Highly recommended to anyone that would like to learn about the Jungle.\nMuy bonita!

471877744.name: interesting, informative, enjoyable
471877744.author: a TripAdvisor user
471877744.reviewBody: My wife and I have lived in the same jungle for 10 years and we realized how much we did not know about it after taking this tour.   Alejandro and Cristal were our guides, and were most informative and enjoyable.   We shared more than a few laughs along with the interesting tidbits they provided about this northernmost jungle on the planet.  Alejandro and his team have done an amazing amount of work to prepare walking paths.   If you are reasonably fit you will have no trouble, but take a walking stick or ask Alejandro to provide one.    The orchids\' peak bloom is in April, May and October/November, but we enjoyed it when it was not at peak bloom.

469726967.name: This is a must if you are near San Pancho!
469726967.author: a TripAdvisor user
469726967.reviewBody: Had an amazing visit and learned a ton. This is a great way to escape the main streets and get into the jungle. Alejandro is absolutely amazing and will keep you entertained the whole time.

459181984.name: Must-see northernmost fruit tree jungle/nature preserve!
459181984.author: a TripAdvisor user
459181984.reviewBody: This amazing jungle/nature preserve is a must-visit if you are anywhere near San Francisco, Nayarit. It is only about an hour North of Puerto Vallarta. Alejandro Perla, the owner has created a breath-taking, 3 hour tour of this northernmost fruit tree jungle. He explains to you with passion and knowledge the jungle\'s eco system, introduces you to fig trees, varieties of native orchids (no hybrids allowed), termites, palm trees of all kinds and how they all co-exist in harmony with each other. You\'ll learn about the ways in which orchids live, propagate and eventually die. You\'ll see fig trees that - for decades - have grown up and enclosed palm trees. In winter (Dec., Jan., Feb.) the orchids send out the shoots that will open as blooms in April and May, lighting up the trails with thousands of delicate flowers that emit wonderful scents. In this nature preserve you can still see flora that has vanished from other areas of Nayarit. Clearly, creating and maintaining this amazing jungle paradise has been a labor of love for Alejandro and his helpers. They have created a haven for native flora and fauna. The tour appears challenging, but it is very doable because all paths are solid under foot and well-maintained. The tour also incorporates rest areas. The nature preserve is a non-profit venture not supported by government funding. It relies on tours and personal funding. An awesome experience!

456795442.name: If you want to experience the jungle, take this tour!
456795442.author: a TripAdvisor user
456795442.reviewBody: An excellent tour by Alejandro Perla, owner of the Jungle Garden. He has deep knowledge of the area and the flora. The terrain was challenging but doable for my 77-year-old husband, who is sometimes  unsteady on his feet, and the pace was just right. (Take a walking stick or cane.) We made lots of stops to look closely at the orchids, palms, and vines. \nSr. Perla is a fascinating man who clearly loves the land he is preserving.

453617741.name: A must-see tour of a labour of love!
453617741.author: a TripAdvisor user
453617741.reviewBody: We immensely enjoyed our two hours with Alejandro as he guided us through what is very clearly a labour of love. He and his small team have built a beautiful shrine to orchids and the Mexican jungle, culminating in their piece-de-resistance - the Orchid Sanctuary. A lovely experience that is well worth the trip.

446976656.name: Awesome Tour & Hosts
446976656.author: a TripAdvisor user
446976656.reviewBody: We had a wonderful tour with Alejandro & friends. They were very hospitable, took plenty of time to describe the unique jungle location. They were especially excited when I proposed to my girlfriend in their greenhouse! We look forward to joining them again soon.

446605792.name: Beautiful jungle garden worth seeing
446605792.author: a TripAdvisor user
446605792.reviewBody: The property is a fabulous part of the jungle that has been lovingly & laboriously groomed by the owner as a living laboratory for local flora. The orchids and bromeliads are fabulous, and we weren\'t even there in the blooming season!\n\nI highly recommend this place for a visit any time you\'re in the Sayulita, Punta de Mita, San Pancho area.

436394218.name: Great Trip!
436394218.author: a TripAdvisor user
436394218.reviewBody: Our guide Romero was an absolute delight!  He drove us to the Garden and gave us copious amounts of information regarding the area, wildlife and plants.  He even gave us their recipe for an organic insect repellent that they use on their plants!  Many, many orchids in bloom, flower spikes about 5 feet long on some of them, many Oncidiums will be blooming by the end of this month (November).  I highly recommend this trip, I would love to be able to go once every 3 months to see all of the various orchids when they are in bloom.  My friend walks with a cane, and had no trouble with the paths and hilly terrain, as the paths are very good, and there are places to sit and rest along the way.

405927091.name: Welcome Change of Pace
405927091.author: a TripAdvisor user
405927091.reviewBody: After several days at all inclusive we wanted to see some of the "the real Mexico" and this was perfect.  Romero was our guide. Though he has taught himself English he did quite well and we enjoyed his many stories and information he shared about las lomas and his family.\n\nThe jungle was beautiful though no flowers because it is off season.  We still enjoyed our trek in the wild and getting to see some of the real Mexico firsthand.

368724264.name: Peaceful, majestic jungle setting
368724264.author: a TripAdvisor user
368724264.reviewBody: We were surprized and pleased by the beautiful jungle setting and all the wonderful plants.  Ramiro, our guide and Jose his father work very hard to keep the garden natural.  They have immense knowledge of all the plants and trees in the jungle.  There are orchids and bromeliads planted on every tree and piece of wood.  It is fascinating to see them attach themselves and grow.  The orchid greenhouse had many plants in bloom and we were encouraged to smell each one to discover their different fragrances.  The road in is a bit rough.  We were happy we had our high clearance vehicle.  The walking is not difficult and the pace is very slow and leisurely.  All in all it was a gem of a place and one to recommend when visiting the Riviera Nayarit if you enjoy nature.

346263147.name: Heaven
346263147.author: a TripAdvisor user
346263147.reviewBody:
A slow walk through the jungle, with a view of the ocean.
The guide explains what they are trying to accomplish here. Returning the jungle back to it's original state. The orchids are beautiful when in bloom, as are all the wild flowers growing there. We where greeted by Magpies and while on a break the Woodpeckers made a little show for us.
Groups are small 4 to 5 people at a time.
I'm going to go back again to see the orchids before I leave.

345576767.name: Wonderful walk through the Jungle with a great guide!
345576767.author: a TripAdvisor user
345576767.reviewBody: Small group on our tour and a very personable guide who worked very hard to help us see all the wonders of the Nayarit jungle.

343439118.name: Magical, wonderful, beautiful Lo de Perla jungle tour
343439118.author: a TripAdvisor user
343439118.reviewBody: I have taken family and friends to Lo de Perla twice in two months and am going back again next week.  If you are at all into gardening and flowers, this is the trip for you.  Crystal has been our guide on both trips and she is so very knowledgeable about all of the trees and plants and you absorb interesting little tidbits of information that stick with you.  The jungle tour is wonderful and interesting but for me, the highlight was the orchid greenhouse.  I had never been particularly fussy about orchids but my opinion was turned upside down after being in the greenhouse.  Did you know that some orchids have a gorgeous scent?  Their colours are amazing, everything from snowy white to brilliant orange and brilliant yellow.  The bloom time for most of the outside orchids is April/May (I think), I will be going back again towards the end of April to see the outside orchids in their full glory.  Both times I have been we have seen various types of orchids in bloom along the paths.  In the greenhouse they range from very small, less than an inch, probably closer to half an inch, to massive flowers four or five, or more, inches across.  I can\'t say enough wonderful things about Alejandro\'s wonderful undertaking and the reintroduction of indigenous flora.

334851521.name: Beautiful garden
334851521.author: a TripAdvisor user
334851521.reviewBody: Lo de Peria is a natural garden located in the jungle on an ocean bluff just north of San Pancho. We were shown the garden by Crystal and Jose who were marvelous hosts. Though we were off season for orchid bloom, we saw orchid flowers, birds, butterflies, interesting plants, and ocean views. It was evident that lots of work had gone into establishing the trails through the jungle.  As garden lovers, the visit to Lo de Peria was a highlight of our trip.

233778452.name: Excellent jungle tour
233778452.author: a TripAdvisor user
233778452.reviewBody: Lo de Perla Jungle Garden. It\'s a huge collection of orchids in a jungle. You are taken on a guided walk through well tended pathways in the mountainous jungle north of San Pancho. Artfully attached to the native trees are 1000s of orchids gathered from around the world and also cultivated in their greenhouses. Three guides accompanied us on the tour, one of whom had all the information and knowledge. A second guide interpreted in English for us. They point out all sorts of highlights of the indigenous trees and vegetation as well as explaining all about the orchids which are obviously the focus of the collection. They wind up the tour at the top of the hills at Lo de Perla\'s staging area where there\'s a beautiful hand made cabana with tables and chairs. Here we were offered water and fresh fruit. Several carefully maintained greenhouses are used to propagate and tend orchids and cacti. The whole experience was charming and heart warming and a good short hike through beautiful jungle landscape.

195614379.name: Wonderful experience, visual delight, awesome setting!
195614379.author: a TripAdvisor user
195614379.reviewBody: A group of 6 of us from Lo de Marcos toured the jungle garden of orchids, cacti and bromelias.  I would highly recommend this for anyone interested in the jungle experience.  Beautiful paths through the gardens led by Vicente.  The vision of the owner Alejandro Perla is incredible.  We learned so much!  Thank you to all who work there...your love of the jungle gardens and the cultivation of the orchids shows.  The best time to see the orchids in bloom would be later March, April and May we were told.

190640391.name: Fantastic tour out in the jungle! over 1000 species of Orchids and local plants like cactus..!
190640391.author: a TripAdvisor user
190640391.reviewBody: After calling A. Perla, he came to pick us up at the agreed time and drove us out to the jungle. Even if it was a rainy day it was worth walking the openair orchids-trail: we got a 2.5h guided tour in the morning, got a lot of interesting or entertaining information abou torchids and other plants, like local trees, bushes, cactus, herbs, fruits and veggies. sometimes you can even see animals, too. It was marvellous being out there in the jungle, and see the orchids growing naturally on the trees. At the end of the tour we got a coffee and a little snack and we shared insights. I had a great experience! I\'d recomend it to everyone like couples, solo, friends, families, elder people! http://lodeperla.com/

189778659.name: Discovering Nayarit\'s orchids and jungle
189778659.author: a TripAdvisor user
189778659.reviewBody: Going to San Pancho to hang out on the beach and enjoy the beautiful town and it\'s amazing hosts is made all the more special by learning about Nayarit and it\'s spectacular jungles and wildlife from the gregarious, knowledgeable Alejandro, Jose and the other hard-working caretakers of the Jungle Garden. Just a 10 minute 4WD truck ride from Entre Amigos in San Pancho, you suddenly find yourself in the pristine jungle that opens up to beautifully constructed walks that introduce you to the many, many kinds of life that live and flourish in Nayarit. With guides at home in English and Spanish I would recommend this to anyone of all ages. The paths are not steep (though probably not suited to wheelchairs that don\'t do off-road very well) so great for everyone. The 3 hour tour went by quickly given how much there was to learn, and the hosts know the area\'s history and how they intend to maintain the gardens and jungle for future generations to come. Please come and support them: for the small amount they ask in donation to support the tour you are giving the gift of life to these beautiful Nayarit orchids and surroundings.

189747689.name: Extraordinary
189747689.author: a TripAdvisor user
189747689.reviewBody: Amazing just amazing!!\nIt\'s an incredible place where you see a lot of different plants and trees and where you feel that you are in a place that invites you to keep exploring and looking for new plants. I recommend this place for sure....

670770612.name: Amazing facility...Great Brunch!
670770612.author: a TripAdvisor user
670770612.reviewBody: Amazing horse/equestrian facility.  State of the art facility with an eye for the design and clean modern lines that didn\'t seem out of place in the lovely little valley. We walked around the stables before the match and watched them get the horses ready. Very cool. My wife was really into it.\nWe went for the Sunday Brunch and polo demonstration game that was lots of fun to watch. My wife was into the polo as she had some exposure to the game as child. It was my first experience of any kind. Beautiful horses. The food was diverse, tasty and fresh. Great service with open bar (mimosa anyone?). Other fun little activities for kids. Also live music as soon as polo was over. Highly recommended.

665606473.name: World Class!
665606473.author: a TripAdvisor user
665606473.reviewBody: I just happen to find out about this in a magazine that I casually picked up. We made a reservation and went, and it was fun! The staff is excellent, the food was excellent, the drinks, the polo match, the live music - just an all around great experience at a world class equestrian center. There was plenty of shade, beautiful view, great seating, and the barn is so clean you could eat in a stall!  I\'m an equestrian and ride at a nice show barn, but this was tops! Very impressed!

663146140.name: Great way to spend a morning!
663146140.author: a TripAdvisor user
663146140.reviewBody: Such a beautiful setting and enjoyed learning about polo.  The food was delicious, fresh, and abundant, as was the mimosas!

659644162.name: Not just a Polo game ... a whole lot more
659644162.author: a TripAdvisor user
659644162.reviewBody: A visit to a Sunday Polo game was NOT on our agenda .. however at the very strong suggestion from a good friend who experienced this last year we decided along with the other couple we where with to attend. We booked online prior to arriving - this is a little of a challenge as it is all in Spanish but we managed. To our total surprise when we arrived the venue was truly first class - the cost includes a wonderful BBQ with a very wide selection of seafood and meats along with salad bar - and it is all you can eat. We had a driver for the day and they provided him with a full meal also which was very much appreciated. Mimosa\'s are free flowing all day and also inclusive. They have a full bar at reasonable prices. After we enjoyed a wonderful meal and some local wines it was time for Polo. They have an announcer who provides a very well informed explanation of the game in English and then it was \'let the game begin.\' WOW it is fast and exciting and we all really enjoyed the experience. After the game the players and coaches mingle around for drinks and photos etc and are very happy to chat to novices ( first timers ) like us.

655823994.name: Beautiful area and so much fun to visit......
655823994.author: a TripAdvisor user
655823994.reviewBody:
We were thrilled when a friend asked us to go to La Patrona with them.
La Patrona polo club is absolutely amazing. The horse stables, polo fields are 
modern and well kept. We were warmly greeted by Martin and my husband totally enjoyed his polo lesson from him. I did not ride but after talking to Martin I gained a great understanding regarding the rules and procedures of the game. We are also looking forward to going to La Patrona on Sunday to watch polo and enjoy Brunch, many of our friends have gone and all have raved about how delicious it is.
We recommend visiting La Patrona, you will be happy that you did.

654509092.name: La Patrona offers a truly amazing experience!
654509092.author: a TripAdvisor user
654509092.reviewBody: I tried polo for the first time. When I arrived at La Patrona I was awestruck with the beauty of the place. Then I was even more impressed when I met Martin who taught me the basics of polo. His personality and experience were very reassuring, and gave me the confidence to give this opportunity my best effort. Within a few minutes I was actually riding a polo pony up and down a polo field, hitting a white ball through the goals! It was so much! It helped that I was riding a very gentle, good-tempered polo pony.\nA few days later, I returned for a second lesson, this time I brought along a friend for her first polo lesson. She also received instruction from Martin and had a blast with me on the polo field. Neither of us had very much prior riding experience, so it\u2019s noteworthy that La Patrona offers a truly amazing experience for first-timers like my friend Janice and me. We look forward to coming back for more riding and even a Sunday brunch.\nI urge you to give it a try like we did, you may even see some pros play a chukker!

653948527.name: Great Polo and Fun events at La Patrona!
653948527.author: a TripAdvisor user
653948527.reviewBody:
We have a house near La Patrona and  we’re lucky enough to have discovered it soon after it opened. We have been playing polo there, as well as attending their Sunday polo brunches ever since. 

The property is absolutely stunning and is a top notch, world class facility. The polo manager is a great coach, the grooms are cheerful, extremely helpful and the horses are well trained and easy to ride! 
I can highly recommend it not only for polo players (even beginners!), and riders but also just for spectators. 
They have recently opened a spectacular beach club, which is on the beach. It has a lovely ambiance and great cuisine. This incredible development is one to see and one to watch as it grows!

649535119.name: What a find!
649535119.author: a TripAdvisor user
649535119.reviewBody: We randomly stumbled onto this place while walking down the beach. What a beautiful surprise! We ate dinner and watched the sunset - and enjoyed ourselves so much we came back the following morning for brunch. While pricier than most other spots in the area - the food is excellent and creatively plated. The atmosphere was incredible and staff extremely friendly. While we spent most days eating at San Pancho restaurants - this was a nice change of scenery. We will definitely be back!\n\nTip: La Patrona is only a 15-20 minute walk from the main San Pancho beach area if you walk along the beach. You can access the restaurant from the beach. The street route takes much longer to walk and is much less picturesque.

577120503.name: La Patrona was amazing!
577120503.author: a TripAdvisor user
577120503.reviewBody: The brunch and exhibition Polo Match was wonderful!  The grounds were beautiful and the brunch was reasonable and delicious.  It included bottomless mimosa. The service staff waited on us hand and foot!  The brand new buildings are lovely. \nWe would go again!

642523908.name: Artsy Local Market
642523908.author: a TripAdvisor user
642523908.reviewBody: My wife loved the market here. Only on Tuesdays I believe, but runs most of the day. Has the usual market fare of womens clothing and trinkets and local artisans and bakers. A few fresh food stands set up. Definitely not my thing, but if you want to grab some local baking and an overpriced set of drink coasters this is your place.

575671314.name: Nice local market in town
575671314.author: a TripAdvisor user
575671314.reviewBody: This market takes place on Tuesdays right near the main street of San Pancho.  There are many local vendors selling their goods and food with a musician playing regional music.  We grabbed many great presents for people at home.  Vendors were very friendly.

567912797.name: Great local market
567912797.author: a TripAdvisor user
567912797.reviewBody:
The market is a hive of activity every Tuesday!
Great place for crafts, food, live music, produce, baked goods and more! 

There were fewer tables this week but everything you need was available. 

We're always able to load up on fresh food and produce for a couple of days.

Highly recommended!!

567505773.name: Lovely, great original and organic options - be ready for higher prices
567505773.author: a TripAdvisor user
567505773.reviewBody:
This is a really sweet location, shaded, in the square by the beach area, with many stalls, you can purchase some great organic produce, local herbs, peyote creams, no refined sugar, homemade foods, breads,granola, snacks (lunches), spices, teas, pizza, sausage, jewelry, juices, flavored waters, as well as the usual tourist blankets etc.

Some stalls have US/Canadian market priced goods and are non-negotiable.

Many are english/bilingual speaking, but the use of calculators makes questions on price very easy anywhere.

Bring a bag to help the constant use of plastic that is present.

Feel free to go hungry and eat there - some fantastic looking sausage, pizza's, quesadilla's, multi colored tortillas. There is lots of options.

Shaded benches along with the covered area makes it a great option for enjoyment of a sun covered space to take a break.

564407173.name: Authentic, low key market
564407173.author: a TripAdvisor user
564407173.reviewBody: Love this little market, been there four years in a row, and each time it continues to give me a good feeling of culture,  community and always has great live music, performances. Don\'t miss the man who  makes stunning art out of tree bark - best item in the market besides the chocolate!

552055433.name: Charming weekly market
552055433.author: a TripAdvisor user
552055433.reviewBody: The San Pancho mercado on Tuesdays has a very nice collection of vendors. The jewelry and clothing vendors are particularly good. My daughter got a beautiful pearl ring last year. New this year is a vendor with bark art. Go just for the candied pecans! Relaxed and friendly atmosphere with just enough to keep you busy for an hour or so.

471772041.name: Tuesdays, town market time
471772041.author: a TripAdvisor user
471772041.reviewBody: Nice setting for a local market. The brick open air building is the focal point in the plaza and adjoining park. The roof keeps it shaded and cool. Go early to get the best selectioins.

470195331.name: Food and crafts
470195331.author: a TripAdvisor user
470195331.reviewBody: We\'ve been there many times.\nA good mix of food, crafts and live music. A regular Tuesday community event, small but the place to be!!

460223463.name: I\'d call it "Cozy"
460223463.author: a TripAdvisor user
460223463.reviewBody: This market is a nice break if you are in San Pancho on a Tuesday.  Some great fruits and locally made food and snacks are there.  I was impressed with the organic tobacco even though I did not buy any.   There is plenty of jewelry and some quirky \'gringo\' sales but you should really go for the local goods.  \nThere is good cover from the sun and possible rain.\nGetting to San Pancho on the bus only depends on how much or little you want to spend but the busses only go to the entrance of the town so prepare for a 10 minute walk.

447230516.name: Small local outdoor market
447230516.author: a TripAdvisor user
447230516.reviewBody: A small weekly outdoor market in San Pancho.  It\'s a great place to grab some local street food, cold fruit drinks, a loaf of yummy olive bread, or a small trinket.  Very few fresh market items though.  We did grab some great locally grown lettuce. One street over the the center of town and many other shops!  The town is pretty quiet and a welcome relief from the more touristy locales.

674247626.name: Great little beach town
674247626.author: a TripAdvisor user
674247626.reviewBody: We stayed in San Pancho for 3 nights and it was a perfect trip. The town is small enough to walk around but there is a variety of restaurants and something for everyone. The beach is clean and the sand is really nice. The waves were pretty strong, especially for kiddos, but we had a lot of fun playing on the beach and going for beach walks. There were lots of little shops to duck into for bringing home an artisan piece of jewelry or home good. Definitely recommend for families!

673082343.name: Super cute, funky, amazing town - beautiful beach with powerful waves!
673082343.author: a TripAdvisor user
673082343.reviewBody:
We can't even begin to describe just how MAGICAL San Pancho (San Francisco) is and how much we loved it! We ended up falling in love with the town and canceled our plans to stay in Sayulita so we could stay in San Pancho for longer! We checked out Sayulita for a day, but it was overly crowded and super touristy and expensive.....and sadly Sayulita has a bad sewage problem that has made the beaches there very unsanitary...which has gotten many people extremely sick! San Pancho, on the other hand, is small, funky, fun, affordable, and safe...plus the beach is clean and safe for swimming and surfing. It boasts some incredibly delicious restaurants and cute shops. We also like the size of the town...over time as we got to know people we kept running into our new friends, which turned into group meals and hang-outs. The locals (both Mexican and the gringos) are all super friendly and we just loved the people and the town!

Keep in mind that the beach has powerful waves and is not good for small children for swimming...if you are looking for more of a calm beach, I recommend Lo de Marcos, which is the next town up the coast. There are also no lifeguards at this beach or Lo de Marcos (there is one at Sayulita but until they fix their sewage problem DO NOT GO SWIMMING OR SURFING THERE...you'll get sick!). Our favorite place to stay was La Colina, for snorkeling we loved Santa Madre Adventures, and Limbo has the best tacos!

Can't wait to come back to San Pancho - we miss it already!

672563708.name: Bliss.
672563708.author: a TripAdvisor user
672563708.reviewBody: Don\'t go here. I\'t\'s  just too delicious and I want it all to myself.  Not huge crowds, the town feels like a town rather than Surfer-Disney-Mexican Style like some of the nearby meccas.  \nthe waves are not great for beginner surfers, but the whole experience is just perfect for advanced relaxers.

670316534.name: Beautiful beach and nice crafts being sold
670316534.author: a TripAdvisor user
670316534.reviewBody: We stopped here during a private tour from our cruise ship. Wish we had time to enjoy the beach and go in the water. It was a nice beach and there were all types of interesting crafts being sold. They appeared to be good quality.

669223475.name: Best little Beach Town I\u00b4ve been in a while
669223475.author: a TripAdvisor user
669223475.reviewBody:
Recently had a vacation in Nuevo Vallarta that was great in many ways but the highlight of the trip was San Pancho, there is a lot o talking about the near by town of Sayulita which is OK but, for my test too overcrowded and too touristy and that is something I prefer not to have on my vacation , so we decided to explore San Pancho and were very Happily surprised, this Town is the real thing, the ambiance , small bars and restaurants, the scene in general was very relaxed and laid back, walking around town was a real pleasure and a short walk since its not too big, but the real fun started when we got to the Beach, there is practically no hotels and mainly just houses and a few restaurants so without being a secluded place it was very enjoyable. There is a few different kinds of offers in terms of parking at the beach from very simple Umbrella and chair to a better level "palapas". 
The sand strech on the beach is perfect for relaxing , walking , and enjoying the beach life in general, and the waves are great, not calm and easy but not dangerous at all either so a nice and fun activity to spend the day.
ere there on High season and the amount of people was very OK , I imagine in low season it must be amazing
This time we stayed at one of the Hotels in the Riviera Nayarit but next time I´m definitely staying in San Pancho

661411941.name: Nice day trip
661411941.author: a TripAdvisor user
661411941.reviewBody: My wife and I visited San Pancho on a day trip from our vacation villa in Sayulita. Beautiful beach to walk along, and the water was perfect. Go for a couple of hours, enjoy the little town, and have a beer at the great beach restaurant at the end of the main street.

660014200.name: Great day at San Pancho
660014200.author: a TripAdvisor user
660014200.reviewBody: Our day started by finding a table at a beach bar - sorry, I didn\'t even look for the name... It was on the right as you walked down to the beach. The food was good and they were always busy. Anyway, if you like to surf, this would be a great place for you. I\'m not a surfer, but there were a lot of them there. It was like a little village of tents on the beach with a lot of surfboards around. The waves were bigger than I\'d ever seen. It seemed the beach had its own little bay, and the walk from one end to the other was maybe a kilometer. It was very clean as well.\nThe town as well had a great vibe. Kind of Hippy-ish.

656998859.name: nice sand
656998859.author: a TripAdvisor user
656998859.reviewBody: nice quite beach but getting crowded now , love little town and beach worth a visit for a day , we went on bus great fun .

656105769.name: Getting very crowded
656105769.author: a TripAdvisor user
656105769.reviewBody: We have been going to SP since 2004 and we have seen it grow so fast!  The beach is very beautiful, the waves can be rough and there\'s a strong under tow so be careful.

655532752.name: Love the walk
655532752.author: a TripAdvisor user
655532752.reviewBody: I love a great walk on the beach and this location has that. It\u2019s a very clean beach, from one end to the other. There are chairs and umbrellas and staff to accommodate all your needs and desires. The sunset is something you\u2019ll never get tired seeing and won\u2019t be disappointed.

654585412.name: Beautiful Beach
654585412.author: a TripAdvisor user
654585412.reviewBody: Beautiful beach in a really quaint town.  Handy bar and restaurant right on the beach.  Nice waves for the surfers and yet there is some areas of fairly quiet surf for kids to play in.

653119782.name: Nice beach, particularly at sunset.
653119782.author: a TripAdvisor user
653119782.reviewBody: Such a great vibe where locals, expats, and tourists interact easily with one another.  The walk on the beach might take 30 minutes end to end..  Decent waves, some surfers, but when we were there the waves broke pretty close to shore, translation?  Not that great for body surfing.  \nWe were there close to sunset every evening sipping a margarita watching the sun go down.  Peaceful and magical

653048707.name: Bueno
653048707.author: a TripAdvisor user
653048707.reviewBody: This place is awesome. Great sand, water is nice but the view of the sunset is one of the best. Also, the sunset celebration is really fun with a great family vibe....only sunset celebration to top this was Beneras Beach in Ibiza.

647190895.name: Charming
647190895.author: a TripAdvisor user
647190895.reviewBody: Visited by Uber from Puerta Vallarta about 50 mins away well worth a visit \nQuaint town with surfer / hippy feel to it \nCobbled streets with bars and restaurants and a great beach laid back feel ideal retreat

647057599.name: Sand and Waves - a surfer\'s dream.
647057599.author: a TripAdvisor user
647057599.reviewBody: The beach is excellent with lovely sand and you can stop at any lounger free with a palapa by ordering a drink and maybe some food.

646994048.name: Great little beach!
646994048.author: a TripAdvisor user
646994048.reviewBody: Nice beach a little removed from the tourist community. Much busier than it used to be but not nearly as busy as Sayulita!  \n\nVery strong undertow current in the water, but great bodysurfing & beginner boogie boarding!

645233852.name: Escape to the old world
645233852.author: a TripAdvisor user
645233852.reviewBody: We visited San Pancho over New Years and absolutely loved the feel of this old town. San Pancho reminded us of Sayulita and or Playa Del Carmen, 25 years ago. The street are dirt and cobblestones, the atmosphere is laid back, and the galleries and eating establishments are worth exploring.

645062389.name: Beautiful,friendly and worth the small trip out of the way
645062389.author: a TripAdvisor user
645062389.reviewBody: Clean clean  beach...small but this is a small village....we rented a car for the day in nuevo vallarta and drove north in search of a nice lunch and to explore San pancho ( San Francisco)\n\nWorth the 60 bucks for the car..then visited sayulita..and dinner in buceras.. great trip ending in perfect t su set.

644422069.name: Fun splashing and crashing
644422069.author: a TripAdvisor user
644422069.reviewBody: Great time playing in the surf! I did get tossed around a few times, but mostly I was under control.

642014112.name: Wild Waves
642014112.author: a TripAdvisor user
642014112.reviewBody: We stayed in San Pancho for for days and enjoyed the food and beaches. Playa San Pancho was fun! We enjoyed walking the beach and the beautiful sunsets. It was nice to have a couple restaurants on the beach, to enjoy a beer and food. The waves are fun, but be careful! They can be dangerous!

638121942.name: Peaceful place!
638121942.author: a TripAdvisor user
638121942.reviewBody: Discovered because that is where I have found a AirBnB one month before my flight for Puerto Vallarta. A small village with typical food, handcraft, artisans, musicians. It\u2019s good to be outside, days and evenings, beach or streets, watching life: kids, old people, dogs, trucks with speakers announcing tacos or sweeties! A human size destination. Let say \u201cI love San Pancho\u201d

629940631.name: DO not read this review.. this beach is all mine
629940631.author: a TripAdvisor user
629940631.reviewBody: Great for walking, whale, porpoise, bird and fishing boat watching, The undertow is way too much for children and anyone who is not a swimmer and or aware of how to properly manage undertows. teh scenery is stupendous.

611987987.name: Beach Visit
611987987.author: a TripAdvisor user
611987987.reviewBody: The beach in San Pancho is lovely. There are two large outdoor restaurants on the beach right beside the Plaza at the end of the main road into San Pancho. There is a rip current in the ocean so not recommended for swimming and only very experienced surfers ride the waves. The beach offers great walking and is a very beautiful place to spend time. The vibe here is very positive and peaceful. Perfect destination spot.

586527217.name: The essence of San Pancho!
586527217.author: a TripAdvisor user
586527217.reviewBody: Beautiful stretch of gold sand and warm water with magnificent sunsets. San Pancho is a very small town with stoned streets and excellent food for all budgets. When the sun is going down people line up by the beach to say good bye to the sun. It\'s a great place to recharge!

586254517.name: I\'ve been to San Pancho 10 times.
586254517.author: a TripAdvisor user
586254517.reviewBody:
Well I own a house and rental vacation home there so of course I am biased. But I fell in love with the town and beach the first time I saw it. 

Lot's of other reviews have talked about the gorgeous beach, the laid back attitude the hip town. I agree that it is great. I'm just going to put in a plug for some of services and restaurants that we have enjoyed.  The main street is "Tercer Mundo."  

Cervecería Artesanal San Pancho is the place to go for craft beer, treats and to hang out. I love there cold meat/cheese tray.  Last time there, a band was playing blues outside.  This is about two blocks down American Latina from the main street - Tercer Mundo. 

Our favorite place for tacos and enchiladas is Taquería Los Arbolitos... on American Latina one block down from Tercer Mundo. I like their rice/almond drink called horchata. Great flan too. It is very inexpensive.

Ally Cat Sailing Adventures.  This leaves from Sayulita. They have an all day catamaran trip to the Mariettas. It includes snorkeling, paddle boarding, food and all you can drink. They have a diving platform off the back of the boat that is a lot of fun. They have other tours too.

Nativa Surf Shop - San Pancho.  I took my first surfing lesson from them. We did an excursion to La Lancha beach.  They also sell clothing and surfing gear.

La Loncheria Chuyita San Pancho - a great spot for breakfast and lunch.

There is an Italian restaurant called Dulce Amore at the corner of Tercer Mundo and American Latina that we like a lot. Look for a turquoise wall and signs that say "Lasagna" and "Pasta." They have a gelato shop too. La Toscana is also a place we like a lot for Italian.

There also is a large ice cream shop that has excellent fruit drinks

We also have enjoyed a lot of the other larger well known restaurants in town... Barracuda, Mr. Ribs, Maria's, La Ola Rica's.

There are some organic restaurants too. Bistro Organico & Cafe Paraiso are two that we like.

There is a restaurant called Mar Plata that is at the north end of the beach about a half mile from town. This is in the upscale villa residential area known as Costa Azul. It is open seasonally and not every day at that. If you are staying in a home in that area you should check it out.  Likewise for guests in that area there also is a restaurant inside the hotel "Maraica" but we haven't tried it yet.

572924607.name: I\'m reluctant to share....
572924607.author: a TripAdvisor user
572924607.reviewBody: This beach is beautiful, so much so that I\'m reluctant to share or recommend to visit!  We stopped in San Pancho just to check it out.  Wandered the town and then ate at Las Palmas on the beach.  The beach is well kept, wide and has a great slope for plunking down on your beach chair or blanket.  The adjoining scenery is nice as well. Great vibe overall.  If you must (and really, you must..), check it out.

571366243.name: Very cool hipster beach
571366243.author: a TripAdvisor user
571366243.reviewBody: The whole town of San Pancho has this hipster friendly vibe and the beach is no exception. I will recommend getting here through the market entrance. They do have a restaurant nearby and you can also bring your cooler and beach umbrella so you can stay all day and enjoy the sundown or sunset.

570285464.name: A fun beach to swim or people watch
570285464.author: a TripAdvisor user
570285464.reviewBody: This is an excellent beach to swim or just hang out. Close to the downtown and restaurants too. We were there for the music festival and you could tent on the beach too! Very clean and not crowded.

570268077.name: I fell in love with this beach!
570268077.author: a TripAdvisor user
570268077.reviewBody: When I first got there I was astounded at the natural beauty of this place. I specially loved the one spot at the south where the jungle meets the sand. Apparently people can camp on the beach. It\'s not crowded at all and it feels a whole lot more natural an experience than nearby Sayulita! If you are into relaxed and natural beaches and a quiet small town I strongly recommend this beach.

568087864.name: Clean and not crowded!
568087864.author: a TripAdvisor user
568087864.reviewBody: We were staying in Sayulita and looking for a beach that wasn\'t as busy, we took the bus to San Panco, so glad we did. \nThe beach as a much smaller club scene in the entry way than Sayulita ( like a 20th) and you can walk north or south with very few people. We walked both way and than ended up really enjoying the south beach. Nice place for swimming and watch the boats come in and out.\nLooking for a quiet beach, this is it!

566883306.name: Clean and not crowded
566883306.author: a TripAdvisor user
566883306.reviewBody: This is such a pleasant beach for walking any time of day. There are many birds and not too many people.  Easy access to services.

565877560.name: Absolutely beautiful town and beach area ... people are so friendly and helpful ... loved it!
565877560.author: a TripAdvisor user
565877560.reviewBody: We recently visited San Pancho while visiting the Puerto Vallarta area of Mexico.  This is an absolutely beautiful town full of Mexican culture, and wonderful, welcoming people.  We loved it here!!!

564614945.name: Amazing beaches
564614945.author: a TripAdvisor user
564614945.reviewBody: Had 2 small boys with me and we spent the whole day playing on the beach and boggie boarding.\nHad the fortune of seeing some baby\u2019s turtles making their any to the ocean for the first time and in general a great family day out.

564455503.name: Great place to chill out
564455503.author: a TripAdvisor user
564455503.reviewBody: The sand feels so good on your feet. The clean air is a pleasure to breathe. And there are lounge chairs to disappear into. Get a massage, have a meal, have a jumbo margarita, get a tan, soak up vacation. This beach is one of the quiet ones. We took morning strolls, afternoon naps and immersed ourselves in the full moon at night. It is not best best beach for swimming because there can be dangerous undertows and rip tides, but if you walk to the south end you will find more protected water. There are places to camp right next to the waves, if that is what you like to do. There is some surfing but the waves have a tendency to break close to the shore but if you read the weather there can be some awesome waves to catch, just use common sense. One real word of caution, DO NOT swim in the nearby lagoon.

563573690.name: Beautiful Beach and Great Place to Catch the Sunset!
563573690.author: a TripAdvisor user
563573690.reviewBody: Nice long beach to walk and if you head south past the river, the tides are a little less crazy and a great place to swim.

562206641.name: The break makes swimming a challenge
562206641.author: a TripAdvisor user
562206641.reviewBody: Because the wave breaks right on the beach, swimming, especially for children, is not good.  Not surfing, not paddle boarding, etc. It\'s a beach for walking, sitting, drinking, eating.

561589609.name: Pristine and Clean!
561589609.author: a TripAdvisor user
561589609.reviewBody:
A beach everyone would hope they could find one day, or evening.
Fine, and golden sand, rustic shore-line, and flat enough for all families and ages.
Environmentally ideal, as there are few people enjoying it ---so far!
Yet, food and beverages are not far away. Beach front cantinas and restaurants
are reasonably close by. Waves here are spectacular. And there are several areas
having friendly access to the ocean.
This is a "Must-Enjoy!"

561328459.name: Cute town with a great beach
561328459.author: a TripAdvisor user
561328459.reviewBody: We took the bus from Bucerias with the kids here one day to experience something a little different.  The bus drops you off at one end of town and you walk all the way through town to get to the beach.  What a quaint place!!  We had a drink at a restaurant on the way, enjoyed the little park with our little one, shopped a little and ended up having lunch on the beach.  We then walked back through town and caught a cab back to Bucerias.\n\nSan Francisco is a very cute, authentic village in Mexico.  I can envision staying here at some point in the future.  We loved the feel, ease and simplicity of this small town.  The beach was very pretty with plenty of tourists and restaurants with palapas, umbrellas.  We enjoyed our day and we are very happy we made the day trip!

561119742.name: loved this town ....
561119742.author: a TripAdvisor user
561119742.reviewBody: heard great things about san pancho and decided to go and check it out .... was staying in lo de marcos so very short bus ride to get there.... shops were super cute and environmentally concerned.... food was great and beach was superb.... don\'t miss this treasure

560519981.name: Authentic Experience
560519981.author: a TripAdvisor user
560519981.reviewBody: A quaint, rustic beach town with an enormous, sparsely populated beach.  A surprisingly large number of cute restaurants in a largely undeveloped town.  \nTruly this is off the beaten path.  It was an hour and half taxi ride north of Old Town PV but a world away.  This is what PV must have been like at some point in it\'s history.

559305932.name: Safe and spacious sandy beach
559305932.author: a TripAdvisor user
559305932.reviewBody: This beach is as yet barely known and so there is lots of room to feel as is you have your own private space. There is a small beach spot at the end of the Main Street of San Pancho where there are beach cafes and a few market stalls. It is quite a large sandy crescent and a few minutes walk on the sand takes you away from the main tourist section and you can sit there undisturbed except for a few people strolling by. The waves are big and not good for very young people to paddle in. It is a surfers paradise but the breaks were not crowded out.  There is lots o bird life and the pelicans are fun to watch. While we were there three trawler fishing boats were stationed on the horizon. We were lucky enough to catch sightings of whales breaching twice the week we were there. People come down at sunset and everyone claps as the sun disappears. One evening we built a bonfire and made s\u2019mores before heading in. It was magical. Very relaxing visit, peaceful and safe for all ages. Lots of North Americans there and everyone speaks pretty good English.

556113221.name: Great Beach
556113221.author: a TripAdvisor user
556113221.reviewBody: This is one of the most beautiful beaches in the area. Long and flat but with great waves for the surfers. Alas the place is changing with the addition of new hotels that are beginning to spring up, including one right on the beach. So go and enjoy the unspoiled pristine beach before it becomes another Sayulita

550723476.name: Superlative beach
550723476.author: a TripAdvisor user
550723476.reviewBody: The relative difficulty in reaching this beach makes it our favourite in the area. With almost 2km of pristine golden sand, barely an handful of people can be seen on it. The easier way to reach it from Sayulita is from Avenida del Palmar, following a dirt road starting at the chain where the beautiful mansions end, and proceeding past a small creek for a total of less than 1.5 km. Alternatively follow sayulita beach to the rocks marking the end and past the sign \u201cmalpasso\u201d and its small beach . It is a much more rugged path (walking only) but with great views.

550311677.name: Gorgeous Beach!
550311677.author: a TripAdvisor user
550311677.reviewBody: Amazing, natural beach!  Couple freshwater lagoons, cliffs on either end with tidal pools.  Nature at it\'s finest!

549392634.name: Big, strong waves.
549392634.author: a TripAdvisor user
549392634.reviewBody: Great for boogie boarding, not so much for surfing unless your very advanced and don\'t mind a very short break. Lots of rip current, not great for wee ones.

548086313.name: Mellow beach
548086313.author: a TripAdvisor user
548086313.reviewBody: I love the San Pancho beach, the surf has a bit of a pounding break but it is cleaner and less crowded than Sayulita and you get great sunsets too!  Everything is just less busy and more mellow in San Pancho.  Hey, what is that big white building at the north end of the beach?  Very cool looking!

545596648.name: Surf sun sand!
545596648.author: a TripAdvisor user
545596648.reviewBody: This gem has an onshore breeze and great surf for these parts. South end divided by a tidal lagoon so you\'ll have to get going, swim or wait for 20 min or so for the surge to end. Typical now with vendors renting you an umbrella, chairs,local juice bars and the never ending blanket, jewelry salesman. A nice walk north with the never ending surf. However, the first signs of big development is now there surfside.

540446704.name: Beautiful Sunsets in a natural rustic setting
540446704.author: a TripAdvisor user
540446704.reviewBody: San Pancho was a recommended day trip from our resort in Nuevo Vallarta by the Valet. Thank you, Marco at Grand Luxxe, for the recommendation. We drove to Bucerias, Punta De Mita, Saluyita, and San Francisco, MX all in one day. That allowed us time to enjoy an evening in the water and in the beach where we finished our day with what one of our guests called the best Sunset viewing of our 14 day trip to MX. Not a crowded beach, with plenty of inexpensive places to get food and drink. Nothing fancy here at this location as it is older Mexico at its finest. Local people, animals, shops, and eateries with people even selling homemade donuts from the back of their pickup truck. If you are cool with a natural, rustic, and moderately developed area, then this is the place for you to enjoy an I crowded romantic beach with strong currents and pretty sunsets.

533229822.name: Love San Pancho
533229822.author: a TripAdvisor user
533229822.reviewBody: We have visited and stayed in San Pancho on 4 occasions.  It is a lovely small town with a beautiful beach.  The beach has a pretty strong break most of the time so it is not a place to take young children to introduce then to the ocean but the beach is wide and wonderful.  There are many places to stay and very good restaurants and the general atmosphere is casual and friendly with, so far, no big hotels or resorts, thankfully.  I would caution anyone seeking a quiet vacation to avoid Easter week.  My husband has gone birdwatching with a local guide several times and says he has had an amazing time with huge numbers of sightings.

467791282.name: Sea Kayaking
467791282.author: a TripAdvisor user
467791282.reviewBody: MY group really had a lot of fun on this trip. They got to see places too hard to get to any other way and enjoyed a quiet private beach stop. The instructor was amazing and made everyone feel sage and comfortable.

448662543.name: Kayaking Fun!
448662543.author: a TripAdvisor user
448662543.reviewBody: Great kayaking tour with my family! Tamara and Tigre were great at making sure my 7 year old daughter was safe and having fun. We saw dolphins (and i swear an orca....) jumping in the distance.

303851584.name: lovely and tranquil
303851584.author: a TripAdvisor user
303851584.reviewBody: a little too far from the beaten path, but lovely environment, many bungalows on the steep hill to make for a private environment.\nIt\'s quite a treck to get here so a moto is advisable at the least, not for lazy folks unless you want to lose some weight or get a heart attack.

266166914.name: morning kayak with Tamara and Becky
266166914.author: a TripAdvisor user
266166914.reviewBody: My wife and I booked a morning kayak with Tailwinds in a quiet bay north of San Pancho. The weather was great and the sea calm for an enjoyable outing. Apart from the odd oyster fishermen we were the only people on the water. It was pleasant get away and opportunity to explore the remote coastline. Our guides were perfect hosts if  a little tired from dancing in the streets the evening before. I would recommend this trip to even the inexperienced kayaker as a very safe and scenic outing.

246727180.name: great kayaking!
246727180.author: a TripAdvisor user
246727180.reviewBody: We had a great experience kayaking with Tamara who is a super guide and wonderfully friendly person.  My husband and I went with our 10 year old son and we all felt well taken care of.  It was a very laid back excursion along the beautiful coastline. We saw dolphins and stopped at a lovely secluded beach for a swim.  Good times!

237354720.name: To dream
237354720.author: a TripAdvisor user
237354720.reviewBody: Its a hipichic resort, in which everybody fits in. Special place un which not even the police is needed. Nice food, nice view. Keep it in secret.

190620716.name: An amazing stay in the jungle
190620716.author: a TripAdvisor user
190620716.reviewBody: We absolutely loved our experience at the Tailwind Jungle Lodge. We\'d booked two nights, but there was so much to see and explore that we stayed on for another. The lodge is really out there in the wilderness: a 20+ min. drive from San Pancho, which really made us feel like we were in the middle of the jungle: epic stars, jungle sounds, starlight. We hiked and went to the beautiful nearby beach, and this is an good spot for day trips to Sayulita or Chacala. Tamara and her family are extremely accommodating and welcoming. This spot had a great mix of feeling remote and luxurious at the same time.\n\nThere are a lot of stairs and uneven terrain at the lodge, so I wouldn\'t recommend it for anyone who has trouble walking. I\'d also recommend having a car (which are pretty cheap to rent), as it is a ways out of San Pancho (aka San Francisco).

189647909.name: Awesome kayaking and paddleboarding!
189647909.author: a TripAdvisor user
189647909.reviewBody: Tamara, Judy, and Tigre are wonderful people and great guides for playing around San Pancho!  The kayaking tour was beautiful and we got to see some other towns in the area that we wouldn\'t have otherwise visited.  The paddleboarding was fantastic with flatwater and waves to choose from, plus some bonus yoga on the boards and Corona\'s on the beach afterwards.  You really couldn\'t ask for better hosts.  Super friendly, engaged, knowledgeable, and tons of fun.

187900366.name: Kayaking at its finest
187900366.author: a TripAdvisor user
187900366.reviewBody: I have kayaked on guided trips all over the Western Hemisphere and this ranks up there with the best. First and foremost Tamara and Tigre are very safety conscious and did a great job with the pre kayak safety talk, paddling technique and launch strategy in surf. Once on the water they had a very thorough knowlege of the area and shared it with us. The equipment was perfect for the paddling conditions that are typical of the bay we were in. I highly recommend this company and guides for a wonderful time on the water.

187829277.name: A Great Day!
187829277.author: a TripAdvisor user
187829277.reviewBody: We had a wonderful day doing a three hour sea kayak paddle with Tigre and Tamara.  The equipment was very nice and worked great.
