Tigre and Tamara did a super job of instructing us on how to launch from and come into the beach when the wave were up.  They had a keen interest in making certain that we were safe but also had a really relaxing and wonderful time.  The water and weather could not have been better and Tigre is full of information about the local beaches, birds, flora and other things of interest in this region of the Mexican coast.  The following morning we visited Tailwind Jungle retreat and had a great Yoga session with "Jungle Judy", Tigre\'s wife and Tamara\'s mom. They graciously gave us a tour of their activity center. All was superb and is a great experience with really wonderful instructors/hosts for a very good price. GO FOR IT!

187637862.name: Kayaking c El Tigre and Tamara
187637862.author: a TripAdvisor user
187637862.reviewBody: Kayaking was the perfect way to see the coast of Mexico !!\nTamara and her Dad were so knowledgable, the kayaks easy to master and the ocean here warm and wonderful!  We all - 5 friends and me had a BLAST!\nI highly recommend this experience

186676764.name: Awesome kayaking trip
186676764.author: a TripAdvisor user
186676764.reviewBody: We\'ve been visiting this part of Mexico for the past several years but this was the first time we signed up for a guided tour.  Kayaking was the perfect way to see the coastline.  We\'ve kayaked before so we were off and paddling quickly and spent a wonderful several hours on the water with Tamara and Tigre.  They were great guides and companions on the trip.  The best part was paddling onto the hidden beach for a swim in the beautiful warm waters.  Kayaking was the highlight of my trip to Mexico this year.  Next year we\'ll sign up for paddle boarding!

155665650.name: stand up paddle board
155665650.author: a TripAdvisor user
155665650.reviewBody: Tamara picked us up at our hotel and drove us to a very safe, gentle beach that was perfect for  our lesson.  It is known for beginning to intermediate stand up paddle boarding.  The beach has several little restaurants  with chairs and umbrellas.  Tamara is an excellent teacher and a lot of fun.

153789386.name: Amazing jungle eco-lodge and kayaking/SUP resort
153789386.author: a TripAdvisor user
153789386.reviewBody: Didn\'t stay here, but boy what a great place for a Yoga Retreat!!\nA little remote, but a true get-away from it all.

151855693.name: Wonderful Excursion Guides
151855693.author: a TripAdvisor user
151855693.reviewBody:
We worked with Tamara and her father Tigre who helped set us up with stand up paddleboarding (SUP) and kayaking. The SUP experience was really fun. We had no prior experience but they taught us the basics and then let us experiement and learn on our own while remaining available for additional teaching and support. They also gave us the necessary details on how/where to rent the equipment if we wanted to go again on our own.

Tigre led us on a kayak excursion just north of San Pancho. We had the opprotunity to paddle to a deserted little beach where we stopped for a swim break. It was a really nice excursion and Tigre was a fun and insightful guide. 

We were met at our B&B by the team for each excursion - they were on-time and ready to roll both days. Tamara said that they sometimes do not have immediate access to phone/email at their jungle location, so you may want to leave a bit of lead time to get in touch with them. That being said, we emailed them and they called us back at our B&B, which ended up being an easy way to work out the details. They have a great website detailing the various activities and we found it to be very useful in planning.

148658041.name: Kayaking and Tiger
148658041.author: a TripAdvisor user
148658041.reviewBody: We went kayaking with Tiger and his son Rhett.  We had a blast.  Tiger is very knowledgeable about all things Mexico...and beyond.  This was the highlight of our trip to San Pancho.  Just getting to know Tiger and hearing some of his life\'s adventures was worth it.  To kayak to private beaches for three hours was bonus!

145693334.name: kayaking and yoga!
145693334.author: a TripAdvisor user
145693334.reviewBody:
What an amazing location.....yoga in the jungle, who would have thought! This place has a new yoga platform overlooking the jungle paradise and ocean. If you have never experienced shavasana with the sounds of a living jungle you have to try it!
We also did a fun day kayak trip with Tiger and Tamara to an isolated beach just outside of Lo de Marcos.
A big thanks to Judy for a full tour of the different casitas on their property. Although we didn't stay, we plan to next visit.
Very cool web site.
Steve and Melissa

124615352.name: jeep trip
124615352.author: a TripAdvisor user
124615352.reviewBody: The jeep trip was very interesting but if you get motion sick at all do not take it as you cover some very rough terain.

123945838.name: The most peaceful place on earth
123945838.author: a TripAdvisor user
123945838.reviewBody: If you have ever wanted to push pause on your life button and recharge this is the place to do it. The setting is amazing, very accommodating while allowing you to feel completely integrated into nature. The owners are friendly and passionate about San pancho and they are a joy to visit with. A piece of you will stay there and it will be something in your heart that you can always call on.  I took a yoga retreat in March of 2011 and I still see the swaying palms when I close my eyes and hear the jungle all around me. I hope to return soon.

122670863.name: Sea Kayaking
122670863.author: a TripAdvisor user
122670863.reviewBody: Owner, Tamara , led us on a sea kayaking adventure on a very cloudy morning, but despite the lack of sunshine, her knowledge of the area & the flora & fauna made for a fun trip.  Mother Judy also contributed much  about the region.  Open kayaks and lightweight paddles made for an easier trip than I expected. We were all adults, but wished we had brought the 5 & 6 year olds who would have loved it.

96780139.name: Love the Tailwind Crew!
96780139.author: a TripAdvisor user
96780139.reviewBody:
My wife and I enjoyed an afternoon of Standup-Paddleboarding (SUPing) with Tiger and Judy from the Tailwind crew Thursday, Feb 10. We met them in Punta MIta at El Anclote and had an absolutely fantastic time. Tiger gave us a quick dryland lesson, then took us straight out into the bay. We spent 20 minutes getting comfortable on the boards in the flat water, then challenged the small waves for an hour. Tiger eventually took me into the bigger surf where we had several great rides. We eventually joined Patti and Judy on shore for a couple cold cerveza, then Tiger took me out for another hour. In all, we spent four hours with Tiger and Judy. All in all, very good value for our $60usd per person fee.

This wasn't our first experience with the Tailwind crew. Back in November we went ocean kayaking with Judy and Tamara at Los Ayolos, just north of Guyabidos. It was another great day. We posted a review and some pictures on the Tailwind FaceBook page.

We're already looking forward to our next adventure with Tailwind!

26230468.name: A MUST DO experience in San Pancho
26230468.author: a TripAdvisor user
26230468.reviewBody: Loved our kayak trip with Tamara and Tailwind Outdor Co.  She picked us up at our villa and took us to a charming little Mexican fishing village where we launched off for an easy paddle to a sweet little beach.  We spent time enjoying the beautiful water before paddling back.  Very accessible adventure for a couple of middle aged ladies looking for time on the water and some fun.  To top it off, we had a deliccious lunch at the Tailwind Ecolodge in the jungle overlooking a deserted stretch of beach.  Could not be a more stunning setting.  We had a great time and highly recommend this adventure.  Thanks Tamara -- we\'ll be back to San Pancho.
